Name: Requiring half of all black cars to be accessible to persons with physical disabilities.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring half of all black cars to be accessible to persons with physical disabilities

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on For-Hire Vehicles
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Summary: This bill would require half of all black cars licensed by the Taxi and Limousine Commission—including those using app-based companies—to be accessible to persons with disabilities by 2025.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1.  Chapter five of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-548 to read as follows:
      � 19-548 Accessibility requirements for black cars. Beginning January 1, 2025, at least half of all black cars shall be accessible vehicles, as such term is defined in section 19-534.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law. The commission shall take any actions necessary for its implementation, including the promulgation of rules, prior to such effective date.



JJD
LS 2026
4/4/18
